title: Offering a better, easier life
text:
Life is hard, but it doesn't have to be.

I am looking for a young white woman (18-25) with no children who has found herself either unemployed or in a dead end job and is ready to give up. Maybe you're tired of long hours at a thankless job with no room for advancement. Maybe you're tired of working all day on your feet for a low hourly wage and living paycheck to paycheck and still not making it. Maybe you're just tired -- or lazy! Whatever the reason I'm here to tell you there's another way.

I'm not the best looking guy in Jacksonville -- in fact I'm far from it -- but I've got an amazing career with travel, perks, and an income that's gone up every year consistently since I first arrived in Jacksonville. But, it keeps me very, very busy. For example, just last night I was working until 4:30 am.

As a New Yorker I'm remarkably shallow and materialistic -- a slave to labels and other people's opinions -- and at my age (34) it's simply not appropriate to be single anymore if I'm going to continue to advance professionally, socially, and politically.

There isn't always the time to find someone or work towards or a relationship, so I now find myself trying to pay for someone, the same way as I pay for everything else in my life. If you're not happy with where your life is and don't believe there's anything *you* can do about it, then maybe *I* can help. If you're willing to give up and be with a guy simply so you can quit your 'stupid' job and relax all day, knowing all bills are paid, food is readily available, and you have some spending money -- then I may be the guy for you.

Please note. I am not looking for a sugarbaby. You will receive no money for spending time with me. I am only interested in a serious relationship that will lead to living together and eventually marriage.

I'm in my 40's now, tall and fit, and by now (as do most) when you get older you know what you want, need and are looking for in order for something to spark, otherwise you're just wasting your time.
And at my stage in life, I know what I want, and what it takes for me to 'pursue' a woman, and the number one thing is she must have well kept soft presentable feet. (or be a millionaire, just kidding)(if you don't have a sense of humor get lost)

Yes, I know, every day life is such that not all can have 'model' feet, I know that.

But women who take care of their feet, regardless of a rough tumble life, stand out even more to me.

If the feet are right, everything else usually falls into line, personality, behavior, honesty ect.

Usually women with goat hoof feet, have goat personalities as well, are very sloppy and disorganized as well as uneducated.

Women with soft feet tend to be more educated and self aware.

Not into women with long protruding toe nails like knife daggers, that's a total turn off to me, again I like soft feet that aren't scary to look at.
Look at photo template above, and if feet could be entered in slot, and fit in, than I'd like to get to know you after a few other qualifiers.

1. Be single...must be single, no loose ends, no rogue boyfriends, no going through a divorce, nada, nothing, be 100% single. I don't believe in cheating, not now, not ever.

2. If in military, that would be a plus, as I'm former military myself.

3. Home, house, own vehicle also a plus, means you got it together.

4. Educated beyond street level a plus also.

5. Kids, OK, I have none, always wanted a family of my own, just never worked out, if able to have at least one more kid would also be a big plus, a major plus actually, and a big incentive for relationship to develop further.

How about classic rock, or Jazz, fusion jazz, classical, just other stuff outside immediate environment.

10. Asian, Hispanic, Native American, hippie, fat, thin, Rep or Dem or Independent, just have soft clean feet, your feet will either be my magnet to want to purse you, or repel me away.

And if nothing else just fun writing this add, I've never met anyone on here, doubt I ever will, but ya just never know, and you must admit, if nothing else this has been a very interesting entertaining read.

Myself, tall and fit, have own apt, vehicles, job and lots of potential.
I'm only lacking a mate, a love, someone to motivate me to do more, like Rocky and Adrian.
Need that fire rekindled in me by a special person.

title: The world has gone crazy- lets forget it and do our own thing far away
text:
Hello

I'm in my early 30s and run my own business. I'm a small business owner but I'm not cruising around in a yacht or sports car.

The world has officially gone crazy if you keep up with the news. So much is going on and if you look around, nothing is really 'improving'. I'm not a pessimistic person who sees negative in everything but with my business experience, I can stand back and take an assessment which may be perceived as positive or negative. I can sometimes look at something and connect the dots which some people can't do. 

So basically the title sums it up- the world has gone crazy. I'd like to within the next 5 - 10 years pretty much let the world burn and move on 25 - 50 acres minimum or as much as 100 acres. 

I'd like to run my own fish farm, have a decent farm to sustain myself plus anybody living with me and if there's any leftover from the harvests we can donate all that to those in need. I have 3 years of operating a fish farm experience and I'm so eager to get back into it. I'm not saying like completely live in tents like a bunch of disgusting free love hippies but I don't think there's any benefit living in a dense area full of people who will riot on Friday over cheap televisions or crappy Chinese electronic products. 

A little bit more about me- I'm a college educated, well spoken/written "redneck" who is a system administrator. I have a plan to 'retire' from system administration but at the same time, setup some passive income through some profitable services.

I like to shoot guns, run my own YouTube channel and have moved away from the city to a more rural area. I'm 5'11", 220lbs, extremely bearded, and I'm confident in how I look. I'm not a sweaty, pulling his clothes down kinda guy- I have no issue walking around shirtless. By extremely bearded, it's half way down my chest and not something you would find in a Starbucks or around hipsters. 

Being on over an acre of land is making me want to get on 10 - 25 acres pretty soon and start planning out "retirement" which is the farm and sustainability. I'm setting up my life and career where I can use this land to make some money for things because if the land is paid for and some revenue is being generated to pay the taxes (don't get me started on that rant) everything is good as far as I'm concerned so "anything extra" would be profit and could fund whatever. 

I like being in the cash business of certain types of trades. My current business falls into this category and going back to school to learn a trade would definitely help me, especially in rural areas. It also helps me with my firearms hobby and could open up new opportunities. 

What I'm looking for is a woman who understands the vision and isn't going to try to change the plan. I have no objection to input on the plan idea but I'm pretty firm on it. I've had a few come and go, including one who thought she would drag me around 10 years to finish up her higher education and start her career. I don't plan on leaving the North Florida area as I'm well established here. I like women of all types, looks and politics. If you're a small business owner, are a dreamer or entrepreneur by nature- lets start up a team! I just ask that you be confident in yourself and don't drag any past relationship baggage or drama into my current drama free life. I've got no problem with a woman who has kids but please abide by the no drama rule because I don't need your ex trying to mess up our thing.

In a nutshell:

If you're into outdoors, survival, hunting and camping- we'll do fine. If you're somewhat experienced and interested in it- I think we'll do OK. If you've got this fantasy in your head and have never camped or think the world is a warm fuzzy place- I might not be the type of guy for you.

text:
Ok, so I know many of the people reading this are going to judge me and HATE me and I'm sorry for offending you, but I am only on here to look for guidance and advice. I am a 40 year-old married white male who has been married to my wife for 15 years (together for 16) and have always been faithful to her but circumstances have forced me to look for a woman on the side. Let me explain..

When I first met my wife, she had a voracious appetite for sex and since my drive was also strong we had an amazing sex life right from the beginning of our relationship. Over the course of our marriage, I've seen her interest in sex decline gradually to the point where she doesn't even have an interest anymore. I treat her very well, provide most of the financial responsibility of our household, and make sure that I continue to take her out on dates, buy small gifts for her, bring her flowers, etc. I also make sure that I share equally with the household chores and cleaning. I am still very much physically attracted to my wife and I tell her that I think she's beautiful and sexy quite frequently. But in spite of all these efforts, when I try to initiate sex, my wife participates through the foreplay and then tells me that she just doesn't feel like having sex or is too tired. My wife still tells me she finds me physically attractive and I exercise regularly to keep fit and stay attractive to her so I know that my appearance isn't the issue.

We've had many discussions about this subject and my wife knows how frustrated I have become but she tells me she just no longer has the interest in sex that she once had. I'm very honest and open with my communication with her and I've told her many, many times how the loss of her sex drive has made me feel. My wife has talked to her doctor about this problem and has tried many different anti-depressant medicines but none of them have helped and several of them have even made the problem worse. I've even gone so far as to ask my wife for an "open" marriage but she said "no way".

Although my frustration with this situation has been getting greater and greater, I still have decided to stay in the marriage (at least for now) because I love my wife and believe that marriage is meant to be a life-long commitment. And except for the sexual incompatibility, our marriage is otherwise good. But at the same time, I know that if I don't have sex I will be missing out on a very important part of my life. So the only solution I have been able to come up with is having a secret affair with either a married woman in a similar situation or a single woman who is open-minded and mature enough to be "the other woman".

Does anyone on here know where I should look to find a woman who would be open to dating a married man like myself?

title: High standards seeks high standards.
text:
So I spent nearly an hour making a well informed ad last night and my power decided to spike! So here goes attempt #2...
Hello,
I have spent 15 years in 3 different serious relationships and have spent the last few years single(for the most part).
Translation: I know what I want and I know what I do not want.
I am ready to meet someone that can possibly be my life partner. This time around I am going to do everything I can to keep things amazing! I am also going to be very careful about who I choose to dedicate myself to.
I shall keep this simple yet informative...
Myself:
I am 6 ft 3 in tall and 240 lbs with a muscular/fit build as have gone to the gym 4-7 days a week for the last 14 months.
I have dark hair and eyes and have been told that I am handsome by both men and women(I am 100% straight btw).
Outgoing - I am very determined to be successful and always looking for new adventure.
Open minded - I will try anything and have few fears, I have a hard time with stubborn people.
I frequently travel, sometimes twice a month, if I'm invited to go somewhere, I'm going.
Laid back is an understatement, I lack a temper of any kind and am extremely easy to talk to.
Open and honest - This to me is #1 in any relationship, sometimes I am too open(not compatible with overly sensitive women).
My sense of humor is very dry and sarcastic, I leave many people dazed and confused.
Motivation is a good trait to describe me, I am always looking for new ways to build success or to better myself.
Completely sober/drug free, always have been, never had a sip - This is mainly based on my drive to be successful and happy rather than morals or religion.
Mildly religious - Christian/Lutheran - I am at a point in my life where it is not a big concern and I have no one around me that is religious.
Graduated college in 2005 with a degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Own a Limousine and Bus company as well as an auto transport company.
Very spontaneous and full of surprises!
Responsible - Last time I checked my credit score it was at 826.
Likes:
Traveling!
Road trips to no where
Building unique cars(Rat rods)
Being spontaneous
Call of Duty
Motorcycles
Concerts
Theatre
Cooking
Long walks
Down hill mountain biking
Hiking
Skiing
Anything outdoors
...Just to name a few
Attracted to:
Open/honesty - It would actually make me happy if you told me something I didn't want to hear.. ;)
Open minded/positivity - weather its eating exotic food or flying to Vegas tomorrow morning, don't be stubborn, lets go!
Motivation - This can be measured by how old you are and what you have done with your life.
Appreciation - I have been with someone who was spoiled as a child, no thanks, they could car less about anything special you try to do for them.
Trust - I am not your ex boyfriend, if your going to keep bringing him up got back to him.
Teamwork - What's that you want to help me with my book keeping? lets get married, tomorrow!
Drug free - this is a must, and if you aren't big on drinking that's even better!
Someone that knows how to listen as well as converse.
Good work ethic, successful - it seems they are few and far between these days.
Unnatracted to:
Smokers - I don't know what's worse, the mood swings or the weakness of depending on a substance for daily happiness.
Overweight women - Sorry, just not my thing. It goes hand in hand with ambition and motivation.
Mess - actually, its not my turn to do the dishes, because I wash mine right after I use them.
Gold diggers - Sure I could support you if you were perfect, but we could have a lot more fun in life if "we" supported "us".
Negativity - There is nothing worse than someone sulking in their own shamed brought on by poor choices.
Bad Hygiene - for obvious reasons.
I think I have covered enough here... Now we will have nothing to talk about and might as well go our separate ways.

Perhaps I should mention that I currently live in Minnesota... So why am I posting this in FL?
I am bored of my situation here and have always dreamed of relocating to somewhere other than here, preferably with better weather! I just want a change more than anything, I am tired of the lame people here, the unpleasant weather 8 months a year, and the lack of things to do. So here I am looking for a house in FL on CL, why not find a life partner while I'm at it? I do travel to Florida frequently in case I find someone interesting from this.
If you made it through my post, chances are you may be considering emailing me.
Please do not email me if:
You've already responded to 2 or more personal ads today.
You currently have a personality disorder(bi polar, depression, etc).
You have any std's(I like being clean other than my good hygiene)
You have children(sorry, I want my own).
You are not seriously interested in me.
Your sky is purple..
...And please do not forget a photo! Sure looks are not important, but physical attraction is! Plus its only fair since I have one posted.
Thank you for your time and the best of luck to you in your search!!

title: Attached Man Seeking a Attached Woman
text:
So how do I distinguish myself from the other ads? In short, I will do it with . . .honesty. What's the point in being dishonest about an ad like this? So I will lay it on the table here. In return I want somebody that is honest with me.

Why am I here? Probably the same reason you are. Everyone in a relationship has emotional needs. Each member in the relationship needs to identify and communicate their needs, and learn the needs of the other so they can be fulfilled. Are you married and have lost that connection but don't want to leave? But you do crave affection, communication, and touch? Do you take care of yourself and have free time during the day for lunch? Well, we are in the same boat. It would be nice to have a friend who is out of the "loop" with your group of friends and families. Someone to share your thoughts, feelings, fears, hopes, and dreams. Someone to laugh, tell secrets and fantasies to with an unbiased opinion, and that will be nonjudgmental. If you feel the same, and would like an open-minded friend, then let's talk. My wife (who I do love) is unable to fill my emotional needs. She is preoccupied with work or sleeping. I don't want to leave her. But I am seeking to find the connection I am missing at home.

title: Am I alone?
text:
Ok, so I know many of the people reading this are going to judge me and HATE me and I'm sorry for offending you, but I am only on here to look for guidance and advice. I am a 40 year-old married white male who has been married to my wife for 15 years (together for 16) and have always been faithful to her but circumstances have forced me to look for a woman on the side. Let me explain..

When I first met my wife, she had a voracious appetite for sex and since my drive was also strong we had an amazing sex life right from the beginning of our relationship. Over the course of our marriage, I've seen her interest in sex decline gradually to the point where she doesn't even have an interest anymore. I treat her very well, provide most of the financial responsibility of our household, and make sure that I continue to take her out on dates, buy small gifts for her, bring her flowers, etc. I also make sure that I share equally with the household chores and cleaning. I am still very much physically attracted to my wife and I tell her that I think she's beautiful and sexy quite frequently. But in spite of all these efforts, when I try to initiate sex, my wife participates through the foreplay and then tells me that she just doesn't feel like having sex or is too tired. My wife still tells me she finds me physically attractive and I exercise regularly to keep fit and stay attractive to her so I know that my appearance isn't the issue.

We've had many discussions about this subject and my wife knows how frustrated I have become but she tells me she just no longer has the interest in sex that she once had. I'm very honest and open with my communication with her and I've told her many, many times how the loss of her sex drive has made me feel. My wife has talked to her doctor about this problem and has tried many different anti-depressant medicines but none of them have helped and several of them have even made the problem worse. I've even gone so far as to ask my wife for an "open" marriage but she said "no way".

Although my frustration with this situation has been getting greater and greater, I still have decided to stay in the marriage (at least for now) because I love my wife and believe that marriage is meant to be a life-long commitment. And except for the sexual incompatibility, our marriage is otherwise good. But at the same time, I know that if I don't have sex I will be missing out on a very important part of my life. So the only solution I have been able to come up with is having a secret affair with either a married woman in a similar situation or a single woman who is open-minded and mature enough to be "the other woman".

text: Ok so here is my story and why craigslist. I am a single dad of two. I am almost embarrassed to be on here but the dating sites are so much commitment and I am not there in how desperate I am just yet. With that being said though, I have been single for two years, I work full time, and college educated, I take care of my kids 100% of the time alone, and I could not be in a better place mentally and financially. My problem is is that I do not know anyone in Jacksonville. My time is consumed as a father. I have nothing and no one for myself. I want to find the woman I love, the one woman, but it has not happened. I have come close but everything happens for a reason right? The only area of depression in my life is this. I am lonely. Beyond words lonely. Does anyone want to hang out and watch tv tonight? Maybe have a beer, smoke, or do nothing at all? At this point in life I honestly would love even a conversation. I am so lonely I often cry myself to sleep because I have completely sacrificed my life to everyone else in it that I have nothing left for myself. Maybe I am being to honest, actually definitely am but at least everyone will know going into this. I need affection, to give and to get. I need laughs. I need integration. I have almost forgotten what it is like to have a conversation lol. So does anyone want to text for a bit and then come over around 9? Watch a movie? Anything you want really. I am looking for a young white woman (18-25) with no children who has found herself either unemployed or in a dead end job and is ready to give up. Maybe you're tired of long hours at a thankless job with no room for advancement. Maybe you're tired of working all day on your feet for a low hourly wage and living paycheck to paycheck and still not making it. Maybe you're just tired -- or lazy! Whatever the reason I'm here to tell you there's another way.

I'm not the best looking guy in Jacksonville -- in fact I'm far from it -- but I've got an amazing career with travel, perks, and an income that's gone up every year consistently since I first arrived in Jacksonville. But, it keeps me very, very busy. For example, just last night I was working until 4:30 am.

As a New Yorker I'm remarkably shallow and materialistic -- a slave to labels and other people's opinions -- and at my age (34) it's simply not appropriate to be single anymore if I'm going to continue to advance professionally, socially, and politically.

There isn't always the time to find someone or work towards or a relationship, so I now find myself trying to pay for someone, the same way as I pay for everything else in my life. If you're not happy with where your life is and don't believe there's anything *you* can do about it, then maybe *I* can help. If you're willing to give up and be with a guy simply so you can quit your 'stupid' job and relax all day, knowing all bills are paid, food is readily available, and you have some spending money -- then I may be the guy for you.

text: I wake up, go to work, put in full days, come home, eat, go to bed. I'm not unhappy nor am I looking to make any huge changes but I've come to realize if I don't do anything about it, nothing will change. I'm looking to find someone that's maybe in a similar situation, the actions of the day have become so repetitious that they're no longer actions, they're more like muscle memory. Shouldn't we be doing more? Experiencing more? I think so; but my dilemma isn't with doing more, it's with doing it alone. I want someone, no I crave someone to be there to bounce ideas off of, "hey let's do this today," or, "hey let's go here this weekend." I've been a loner most of my life and I'm very good at it. I enjoy the silence and my own thoughts, I like people watching and being attentive to my surroundings but sometimes I wish I had a distraction. And I don't mean that in a degrading sense, "oh all you are good for is a distraction," I mean that as good thing, someone I would enjoy being distracted by, often and for long periods of time. Not just in a sexual way but others as well. Don't we all need that distraction in our lives to take our minds off everything else? Anyways, parts of me thought I should post this in the rants and raves sections but it's not supposed to be that; more of an observation about where I am at this point in my life and what I'd like to look for going further. I'm young so I'm not in a hurry to rush into anything but I would like to hear from some like-minded women. I'm only picky in the sense I'd like for you to take care of yourself and not need me, independence is truly attractive in the beginning until it gets to the point where we need each other, then the opposite is true. text: Wow I don't know where to start........Let's start off with a lil about me...I'm 6'4" tall vgl, married white male with unusually high sex drive, and the sexual prowess of a porn star, or at least that's what I've been told. So here I sit looking on CL for...hell I don't even know any more. It's not like there is but a few real women who look at this site anymore. I digress, I'm in my early 40's, unhappily married, desperately seeking happiness in all the wrong places. I think I blew my one real shot at love many years ago, my soul mate so to say, the one that just completes me. So does that mean that I am destined to live a life of second best now? Do we really only find one true love in a lifetime? Then what does that leave us to do if we blew it? I need a friend first, and I prefer the opposite sex because....well you guys are just so much easier to look at. I want a girl that laughs at my stupid jokes and puns and then tries to outdo me with her own. Someone who will finish your beer and then go grab another for the two of us to share. A girl that loves tomboy kind of things, like going four wheeling, fishing, working on cars. Very important is a love for all things with a motor, to love going for a motorcycle ride with some friends and maybe get a lil too drunk at the bar and have to sober up a lil before the ride home. Crawling up under the truck in the dirt to install that new part we been waiting to come in the mail. Riding an hour to go to a car show. I know a very automotive inclined girl is rare, and one that likes men might be even tougher, add to it a hottie, and she just became the "unicorn". You see I had this when I was 18, she was a beautiful girl, long black hair and a body to die for. All my friends were in love with her. But I Fuxxed up and thought the grass was greener. We went our separate ways yet she will still contact me time to time, way to much water under bridge to mend anything at this point. Point is I know she exists, but did I only get one shot? I have to think that there is more to life than the once and done or we would be a planet full of miserable people....wait we are a planet full of miserable people, or at least Jacksonville....I am currently married to a sweet girl, at times anyway, very few and far in between lately, who for several years after meeting, I tried to vet her for any flaws. I warned her about my insatiable sex drive(remember my problem at 18?? well I still have it), and she claimed she was fine with it. She knew I liked a cold beer after a long days work, and last but not least that THE most important thing to me was my teenage daughter. After-all wanted to set a good example for my daughter about not shacking up with some guy. I swear to you it wasn't a day later and the woman turned straight psycho on me. I mean now there is next to no sex, she is pretty mean to me on a regular basis. Things I never did in my first marriage that would have surely helped it. So here is my conundrum, at my age I feel I am good looking enough, for one last push to find my soulmate, That caraholic tomboy that wants to spend every chance possible with me, and that loves sex more than most women. She laughs at and tells her own off color jokes and has humor. She is easy on the eyes, but know I am very secure and not jealous so I can handle a successful relationship with a fine ass. BTW I hear how sexy I am all the time as well so....see humor ladies....anyway, I guess what I am here for more than anything is to vent, but posted here out of one last hope that my soulmate does exist she might trip across this. You also must not be self centered or selfish, and should believe in equality and give and take philosophy, because I do!

title: Shaken Not Stirred
text:
"I don't want to live. I want to love first, and live incidentally"

I'm a white city boy. I just moved to Georgia. I take a "young at heart" approach to life. I love red meat and enjoy a glass of wine with dinner. Don't really believe in "depriving" myself. If it makes me feel good I do it. I live for the thrill. I enjoy the finer things in life and prefer sushi to country fried steak. I love to be around other people who enjoy experiencing life to the fullest. I'm very sarcastic and like women who can be sarcastic back at me. I'd also like a woman who is confident and can talk about what's on her mind. I love traveling and make it a point to get out of the country whenever I can. I'd like a woman who is either well traveled herself or who is willing to get a passport and hop the next plane to anywhere. In summary, I'm searching for my fairytale princess.

Ladies, I'm not going to lie, I'm the man your mother warned you about. I stay up late, I have a devilish smile that will make you forget why you're mad in the middle of our fight. I work with my hands and drink life like I drink wine, and I'm looking for a woman who's just as passionate. 

My ideal mate may have been accused of being "high maintenance" by past lovers and it may be partially true. She is classy and feminine, but there is a definite bite to her sense of humor. She knows brand names and her friends call her for fashion advice. She has her own career, her own life and no intention of changing that for a man. She is searching for an independent man who will worship her but doesn't need anyone to take care of her. 



First Date
We would meet at an agreed upon place. Its a warm, clear, beautiful night out. We see each other,,wave,, and walk towards each other. We are both smiling big smiles. We say 'hello!" and give a hug,,,which lingers just for a tiny bit. We have a seat,,,talk,,laugh,,talk,,then decide to go for a walk. Conversation is flowing pretty good with no gaps. We've been chatting for a long time so we pretty much know what to talk about. As a good amount of time go by and we are still walking,,,She sorta casually reaches for my hand. We look at each other and keep talking and having a really nice time. Its getting late, and we both need to be going. I walk her to her car,,and we laugh a lil more,,talk,,,, then we say our good-bye. I lean down,,and she looks up,,,for a nice kiss. Not too long,,but not a quicky. Just enough to show that we are both very happy. Oh,,and of course,,erm..erm... She wants to see me again!


Me:

Sarcastic, sophisticated, witty, dorky, sensitive and free-spirited. Also a fan of adjectives.

A wizard in the kitchen. Gordon Ramsey once told me that I was his idol... Ok, maybe not, but I'm sure he'd love the flavor of my home-made gnocci.

Nomadic Adventurer. I've set foot on five continents and have a thirst for more!

Full of random (and oftentimes useless) information. 



You:

Intelligent, sweet, down-to-earth and adventurous. Bonus points if you're a little bit quirky.

An ambitious go-getter. I'm attracted to people who set big goals and put all their effort into pursuing them. Even if your life's dream is to become the world's greatest thumb-wrestler, I totally dig it.


Pet-friendly. My cat Ally loves to meet new people, but if you're allergic to fur, the two of you probably won't get along. :(

Me + You:

An undeniably awesome couple with amazing chemistry. Let's make the world jealous!
